meanings.definition: In a very intense or extreme manner
meanings.sent1: She ran excruciatingly fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The athlete performed excruciatingly well in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel excruciatingly tried to fit a large acorn into its tiny mouth.
meanings.sent4: The music was so loud that it became excruciatingly difficult to hear anything else.
meanings.sent5: The sun beat down excruciatingly on the hikers as they climbed the steep mountain.

meanings.sent1: The excruciatingly hot stove burned her hand.
meanings.sent2: The excruciatingly long wait at the doctor's office made her anxious.
meanings.sent3: The excruciatingly slow snail race was surprisingly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The excruciatingly sharp thorn pricked his finger.
meanings.sent5: The excruciatingly loud alarm startled everyone awake in the morning.

meanings.sent1: The excruciatingly bad smell in the room made her nauseous.
meanings.sent2: The excruciatingly boring lecture seemed to never end.
meanings.sent3: The excruciatingly messy room was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The excruciatingly slow internet connection frustrated everyone in the office.
meanings.sent5: The excruciatingly loud thunder scared the little puppy.
